title: Handbook of the sociology of sexualities

description: This volume provides researchers and scholars with a broad overview of the contributions of social psychologists and sociologists to the study of sexual relationships and sexual expression across the life course. These contributions include analyses of the dynamics of several types of contemporary sexual relationships - e.g., short-term, long-term non-exclusive, and committed. Chapters analyze the influence of major social institutions - e.g., religion, family and economy - on them. The content and scope of this volume have been carefully chosen to balance coverage of traditional emphases - dating, marriage, commercial sex work, sex education - with new and cutting edge materials - embodiment, Trans*, asexualities. Sections review major theoretical perspectives and the principal research methods. Coverage of sexual orientation is integrated throughout. This volume provides excellent resources for anyone interested in research on sexualities.

contents: Introduction / John DeLamater and Rebecca F. Plante -- Part I. Theories. Sexual script theory: past, present, and future / Michael Wiederman -- Sexual fields / Adam Isaiah Green -- Macro theory in sexual science / Ira L. Reiss -- Studying sexualities from a life course perspective / Laura Carpenter -- Part II. Methods. Surveying sexualities: minimizing survey error in the study of sexuality / Anthony Paik -- Ethnography in a ''sex setting'': doing research in a New Zealand massage parlour / María Pérez-Pérez -- Observational methods in sexuality research / Kate Frank -- Part II. Bodies and sexuality. Unpacking sexual embodiment and embodied resistance / Breanne Fahs and Eric Swank -- Missing intersections: contemporary examinations of sexuality and disability / Amanda Jungels and Alexis Bender -- Trans* sexualities / Aaron Devor and Kimi Dominic -- Part IV. Sexualities in social context. Casual sex: integrating social, behavioral, and sexual health research / Justin R. Garcia, Susan Seibold-Simpson, Sean G. Massey, and Ann M. Merriwether -- Consensual non-monogamies in industrialized nations / Elizabeth Sheff and Megan Tesene -- Sexuality in long-term relationships / Amy Lodge -- Intersectionality: race, gender, sexuality, and class / Angelique Harris and Susannah Bartlow -- Asexualities / Carol Haefner and Rebecca F. Plante -- Cities and sexualiries / Phil Hubbard, Andrew Gorman Murray and Catharine J. Nash -- The queer metropolis / Amin Ghaziani -- Part V. Sexualities in institutional context. The family in flux: changing sexual and reproductive practices / Lauren Jade Martin -- Understanding religious variations in sexuality and sexual health / Amy Burdette, Terrence D. Hill and Kyl Myers -- Sexuality and education: toward the promise of ambiguity / Jessica Fields, Jen Gilbert and Michell Miller -- Sex work / Susan Dewey -- Pornography / Kassia Wosick -- The medicalization of sexual deviance, reproduction, and functioning / Thea Cacchioni -- Sexualities and social movements: three decades of sex and social change / Amy Stone and Jill. D. Weinberg.
